channel.title: Can't make a rule for my router,doesn't have the "gaming button"
channel.description: ok i have a Gnet ip104 router and when i log in and go to into "advanced, i do not have the gaming button to make a rule..so anyone can u plz help me....im trying to make server..and i need to have a rule...

item.source: Can't make a rule for my router,doesn't have the "gaming button"

item.title: Can't make a rule for my router,doesn't have the "gaming button"
item.dc:creator: @masterp00n masterp00n
item.description:
@masterp00n wrote:

[quote=“fr33sc4p3”][quote author=masterp00n link=topic=89139.msg940268#msg940268 date=1172398521]
go to
192.168.123.254
Oh and to find your computers ip click on my sig or click start then run then clcik cmd now type ipconfig get your ip address and you default gateway should be 192.168.123.254

Then there should be a box prompting you to login don’t put anytyhign for username and put admin for your password then click the log in button
click virtual server on the left side

for service port put your servers port e.g 43594
for server ip you put your computers ip then click enable
when your done click save near the bottom

That should work
to check if your ports are forwarded correctly download utorrent then when you download put 43594 for the port to check then click check if ports are open

[/quote]

Not always mines 192.168.0.1 >.<[/quote]
Every routers ip is different depends on router type and model
That is the correct ip for his I have already checked it

Read full topic
item.source: Can't make a rule for my router,doesn't have the "gaming button"

item.title: Can't make a rule for my router,doesn't have the "gaming button"
item.dc:creator: @masterp00n masterp00n
item.description:
@masterp00n wrote:

go to
192.168.123.254
Oh and to find your computers ip click on my sig or click start then run then clcik cmd now type ipconfig get your ip address and you default gateway should be 192.168.123.254

Then there should be a box prompting you to login don’t put anytyhign for username and put admin for your password then click the log in button
click virtual server on the left side

for service port put your servers port e.g 43594
for server ip you put your computers ip then click enable
when your done click save near the bottom

That should work
to check if your ports are forwarded correctly download utorrent then when you download put 43594 for the port to check then click check if ports are open

Read full topic
